lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump expressed empathy with African-Americans, but did not address what has made him so unpopular with them, like his real estate company’s discriminating against black tenants.

byline.contributor: Yamiche Alcindor reported from Detroit, and Alexander Burns from New York.
byline.original: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR and ALEXANDER BURNS

headline.print_headline: Trump Visits  Black Church for First Time
headline.main: Seeking Support and Invoking Faith, Donald Trump Visits a Black Church for the First Time

snippet: Mr. Trump expressed empathy with African-Americans, but did not address what has made him so unpopular with them, like his real estate company’s discriminating against black tenants....
abstract: Donald Trump, who is deeply unpopular with black voters and has been accused of racism, visits Great Faith Ministries International, black church in Detroit; declines to address issues that have put him at odds with black community and instead simply praises Christian values and pledges to make lives of black Americans better.
